bug.short_desc: LDC has not been packaged for F25
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext: The version of the ldc and it's directly associated packages in the Rawhide repository is 0.16 built for f24. There needs to be a f25 rebuild and the version upstream is now 1.1.0.

Upstream dev here. The latest official release is 1.0, not 1.1 â€“ the latter is still in preparation. But yes, it would be great to see the Fedora package updated, as we have been directly getting multiple requests along those lines from users. (We do offer standalone release archives as a fallback, but that's obviously not the way to go in many respects.)

(I meant my previous comment to imply that we would be happy to help if there are things we can do on our end to streamline the release process. As far as I'm aware, there shouldn't be anything out of the ordinary compared to your typical FOSS project, though.)
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.
The problem remains in F26, the current 0.16.1-77 package is for F24.

I'm usually not working on ldc packaging, but I'm doing a quick drive-by update here to 0.17.2. Updating to 1.0 and 1.1 is a bit bigger thing to do as it requires bootstrapping from 0.17.x first; I'll leave it for the package maintainer (MERCIER Jonathan) for now. Not sure if he's still around though; I didn't get a reply to a private email I sent last week.
As for upstream help, looks like aarch64 support is missing in ldc, any chance this could get added upstream? That would very helpful from Fedora's point of view. Thanks.

avgtime-0.5.1-0.3.git20150501.fc25, derelict-3-35.20150730git10a517b.fc25, dustmite-1-27.20150515git3498068.fc25, gl3n-1.2.0-17.fc25, gtkd-3.3.1-1.fc25, ldc-0.17.2-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-b869fe6f77
